pr_title: Trunk-5710:Implement the getByUniqueId(String uniqueId) in SchedulerService.java

timeline.message: Trunk-5710:Implement the getByUniqueId(String uniqueId) in SchedulerService.java

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            	 * Get the task with the given UUID.
          
          
            
            	 * Get task by given UUID.
timeline.author: JudeNiroshan
JudeNiroshan

timeline.bodyText: why this check is needed? log.debug(...) will only log if debug is enabled anyway. I'm just curious.
timeline.author: JudeNiroshan

replies.bodyText: logging directly brings about string concatenation which is abit expensive for the application in terms of its performance thats why under this code snippet we only log a message when the logger's debug mode is enabled
replies.author: gitcliff

replies.bodyText: Do we even need to log accessing a task by uuid?
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: @dkayiwa i used logging a task by uuid because of the unique identification the uuid  brings for the task defined in the task definition but i will go ahead and remove the logging if its not appropriate here
replies.author: gitcliff

replies.bodyText:
@dkayiwa i have removed the logger,,kindly requesting for your review
Thanks
replies.author: gitcliff

timeline.bodyText: I would also write some unhappy paths like, uuid is null and uuid is sql statement like abc' or '1' = '1
timeline.author: JudeNiroshan

replies.bodyText: i think if there is a brief code snippet which can strike the appoint,then its worth going for and avoid unnecessary code repetition
replies.author: gitcliff

timeline.author: JudeNiroshan

replies.bodyText: I guess you missed this
replies.author: JudeNiroshan

replies.bodyText: guess it was fixed
replies.author: gitcliff

timeline.bodyText: Do you think these are useful to the developer? testcase name itself has which method is under testing and class name AKA test suite has which class is under test. What do you think?
timeline.author: JudeNiroshan

replies.bodyText: yes its helpful to refer to the developer to the actual service method being tested
replies.author: gitcliff
